image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives About this object

profileText: A Representative from Pennsylvania; born in Middletown, Dauphin County, Pa., November 21, 1775; received a limited schooling; studied law; was admitted to the bar and commenced practice in Lewisburg, Pa.; member of the State house of representatives in 1812 and 1813; elected as a Jackson Republican to the Eighteenth Congress and reelected as a Jacksonian to the Nineteenth and Twentieth Congresses (March 4, 1823-March 3, 1829); died in Middleburg, Snyder County (then a part of Union County), Pa., September 11, 1854; interment in the private burial ground on the family estate near Middleburg, Pa.

note.content: One of three elected to represent the 9th district.
One of three people elected to represent the 9th district.
One of three elected to represent the 9th district.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: Russ, William A. "The Political Ideas of George Kremer." Pennsylvania History 7 (October 1940): 201-12.
